definition[0]: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something
example[0]: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
example[2]: the transaction of his public duties
definition[2]: a payment, or the process of making one
example[3]: The auditors will conduct regular checks on allfinancial transactions.
example[4]: The bank offers a current account aimed at businesses with regularinternational transactions.
example[5]: Two Mexican firms have completed a $300 million transaction to combine their consumer businesses.
definition[4]: an occasion when a company sells shares, bonds etc or exchanges them for other shares etc
example[6]: The swap of junk bonds was carried out as part of a complicated debt-reduction transaction.
definition[5]: a single action that makes a few related changes to the data in a database or other computer program
example[7]: A database transaction is a unit of interaction in a database management system.
